title: Liverpool vs Newcastle prediction: How will Premier League clash play out at Anfield?
text:
Newcastle head to Anfield seeking a first win away at Liverpool FC in 25 years.

Jurgen Klopp's side have started the Premier League season with four wins, and will look to continue their unbeaten start against Steve Bruce's side.

Bruce has already guided his side to victory at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium this season, but will be without Sean Longstaff for the trip to Merseyside.

Adrian will continue to fill in for the injury Alisson in goal for Liverpool, who could be able to call upon Naby Keita with the midfielder nearing full fitness.

Match prediction?

While Tottenham failed to unlock a well-built Newcastle defence, Liverpool should have too much quality and creativity for Steve Bruce’s side.

A 3-0 home win is our prediction.

When is it?

The match is Saturday’s early Premier League kick-off

It gets underway at 12.30pm.

Predicted line-ups

Liverpool: Adrian; Alexander-Arnold, Matip, van Dijk, Robertson; Henderson, Fabinho, Wijnaldum; Salah, Firmino, Mane

Newcastle: Dubravka; Krafth, Schar, Lascelles, Dummett, Willems; Almiron, Hayden, Ki Sung-yeung, Atsu; Joelinton

How can I watch it?

BT Sport will be broadcasting the game on BT Sport 1, with coverage beginning at 12pm.

Can I stream the game online?

With a BT Sport subscription you can stream the match from your phone or tablet with the BT Sport app.
